page.title: 07Wilkie Hall
page.content: The{Sir David Wilkie}Hall,built in 1897,is situated in the heart of Pitlessie.The hall is commemorated to the famous Scottish artist who lived in the parish 200 years ago. In the Spring of 1985 Pitlessie schoolchildren visited an exhibition of his work in the Crawford Arts Centre in St.Andrews,as part of the Sir David Wilkie celebrations. In front of the hall there is a {memorial}to the men from the village who died in the First and Second World Wars and on the back there is this inscription:- Ypres ,Festubert,The Somme,Armentieres,Dardanelles,Salonica ,all battles in which the men fought.
